text:
> Or maybe it could instead start a timer that if not interrupted will send that point off to be destroyed.
That's a super interesting alternative to last-write-wins. Keep a queue, but expire things in the queue based on how long they've been waiting, rather than how large the queue is. Reminds me a bit of Mini Metro — when too many people are waiting at a station, a little countdown circle-wedge starts running and when it runs out you lose.
